class_notes:
Although our course is highly theoretical, and will consist of readings, lectures, and discussions of famous books in the history of political thought, at various points we will consider equally famous moments in modern political history and their relation to the ideas on the page.
Note: This course is part of Emory's Voluntary Core Curriculum, a group of courses designed to provide the foundation for a true education in the liberal arts.
course_description: Political thought in the early modern period, from Machiavelli through the nineteenth century.
sections: Class Nbr: 3279, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: P. Wilkin, Status: Open
